understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method named 'streamEntireSSTables' which returns a boolean value based on a configuration parameter 'conf.stream_entire_sstables'.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code directly accesses a configuration parameter 'stream_entire_sstables' to determine whether to stream entire SSTables. This configuration parameter controls whether Cassandra can zero-copy stream entire eligible SSTables between nodes, subject to throttling and other considerations mentioned in the Configuration Description.

config_description: When enabled, permits Cassandra to zero-copy stream entire eligible SSTables between nodes, including every component. This speeds up the network transfer significantly subject to throttling specified by stream_throughput_outbound_megabits_per_sec. Enabling this will reduce the GC pressure on sending and receiving node. When unset, the default is enabled. While this feature tries to keep the disks balanced, it cannot guarantee it. This feature will be automatically disabled if internode encryption is enabled.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'stream_entire_sstables' is used in the code to determine whether Cassandra should zero-copy stream entire eligible SSTables between nodes. It checks if full sstable transfers are enabled and if legacy counter shards are present before deciding to stream the SSTables.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever the method computeShouldStreamEntireSSTables() is called in the code. The frequency of triggering depends on the specific use case and workload of the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: Enabling the 'stream_entire_sstables' configuration allows Cassandra to speed up network transfer significantly by zero-copy streaming entire SSTables between nodes. This can reduce GC pressure on sending and receiving nodes and improve overall performance. However, it may not guarantee disk balance and will be automatically disabled if internode encryption is enabled.
